intro: Cypholophus warburgianus, commonly known as the Warburg's bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Cypholophus warburgianus is native to parts of Europe and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas.
